Package main.java.controller

Class LayoutManager

java.lang.Object
main.java.controller.LayoutManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener, DocumentListener, IController
public class LayoutManager extends Object implements IController
Is reponsible for setting up all needed look and feel properties, loading fonts, images etc.
Implements methods for getting fonts or images in other classes when needed.
Author:
Leander

  • Method Details

    • setupUI

      private void setupUI()
      Calls FlatLaf look and feel method, changes appearance of some components. Sets font for every component defined in 'String[] components'.

    • loadIcons

      private void loadIcons()
      Loads all Icons/Images based on defined filepaths in class. Puts Icons to a Hashmap to make them accessable via method.
      See Also:
      • getImageIcon(java.lang.String, int, int)

    • getImageIcon

      public static ImageIcon getImageIcon(String icon, int width, int height)
      Gets, resizes and returns an image contained in the HashMap.
      Parameters:
      icon - Static final String as defined in this class.
      width - New width of image in pixels.
      height - New height of image in pixels.
      Returns:
      ImageIcon resizedImage

      The loaded Image

    • loadFonts

      private void loadFonts()
      Loads all fonts based on defined filepaths in class. Puts fonts to a Hashmap to make them accessable via method.

    • getModel

      public IModel getModel()
      Description copied from interface: IController
      This Interface is used to implement the Strategy Pattern (behavioral). Every view needs to have a controller assigned, that implements this interface. That way different controllers can be used for the same view classes.
      Specified by:
      getModel in interface IController
